channel.title: Twinstone Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [BFLOW-64] Use immutable flow objects
item.description: Make the FlowCarter immutable. Probably it could mean to implement both mutable and immutable classes.

item.title: [BFLOW-63] Include flow id into error messages
item.description:
For example, message

Cannot find default transition for state 'xxx' (and many more)

should be enriched by flow id.
item.summary: Include flow id into error messages

comments.comment:
Does it generally mean that any exception has to include the flowId obtained from the 'flowId' XML tag?

I guess it would be useful when you've more than one flow and you cannot know which flow thrown an exception, am I right?

item.title: [BFLOW-62] Mixed notes from observers
item.description: https://docs.google.com/a/etnetera.cz/document/d/1Z0cts54PJ-5rlVdU42WeUTFxkae7KlW7gLt58FE2ar4/edit#

item.title: [BFLOW-61] Refactor arguments of scanAnnotedBeans
item.description: Refactor scanAnnotedBeans in DefaultFlowProcessor and also refactor AnnotationFlowFactory to scan different beans.

comments.comment: There are too many similar arguments. The AnnotationFlowFactory is too large and without interface definition. Split it . Do not forget how it is created to prevent create annotation flow factory object manytimes.
Create separate maven modul just for testing.

item.title: [BFLOW-57] Default value of condition state
item.description: Add default value to the condition state. Such as 'if (expression) then...' has to find expression. Even if expression doesn't exist (annotated) so it is not ever required to throw an exception if a default value exists.

comments.comment: I'm not sure if it is a non-sense.

item.title: [BFLOW-56] Add examples to the current version
item.description: Add examples as a module of the current version.
item.summary: Add examples to the current version

item.title: [BFLOW-55] Use ASM instead of reflections
item.description: http://asm.ow2.org/

item.title: [BFLOW-54] Flow versioning
item.description: Versioning of a flow that can has more concurrent versions at the same time.

item.title: [BFLOW-53] Subflows
item.description: Create a subflow as a virtual state.

item.title: [BFLOW-52] Add identifiers to listeners, beans etc.
item.description:
Add identifiers to track who is processing.

e.g. String IFlowStatePersister.getStatePersisterId();
item.summary: Add identifiers to listeners, beans etc.

item.title: [BFLOW-51] Refactor relevat classname processor to controller
item.description: Refactor classnames ending with processor to controller if meaning is different. Also refactor package names.
item.summary: Refactor relevat classname processor to controller

item.title: [BFLOW-44] Rollback flow on exception
item.description: Enhance catching exception and use listeners to decide what to do, if there is an exception, probably rollback the flow state, etc.

item.title: [BFLOW-39] Fluent API to create flow programaticly
item.summary: Fluent API to create flow programaticly

item.title: [BFLOW-32] Default transitions system
item.description:
Create default transitions to states.
It means it there is a state 'MyState' it is possible to autocreate the transition 'toMyState' that point to 'MyState'. The transition can be created with a defined prefix or suffix. The builder must check if transition name is not duplicated to another transition name.

Also it is strongly recommended to global enabling or disabling this feature.

item.title: [BFLOW-28] Refactor maven subprojects and complete POM
item.description:
Complete POM, Description, CI, wiki, confluence, JIRA etc.

Event. prepare server.xml rather than POM information directly.
item.summary: Refactor maven subprojects and complete POM

item.title: [BFLOW-22] Add basic API Doc - implementations
item.description:
Add basic api docs to all interface and basic processing classes.

Add apidocs for all packages.

item.title: [BFLOW-14] Global flow configuration
item.description: Add flow configuration tag, tak can be applied to the whole flow as a behavior instead of java code implementation overriding.

item.title: [BFLOW-13] Add global default transitions
item.description: Add global transitions, those needn't be added in a step directly, but there are applicable anywhere. An simple example is a "cancel" transaction, that could be invoked anywhere. The strongly recommended think is append an exclusion mechanism to exclude those transitions form selected steps. It can be defined on transition or on steps.

item.title: [BFLOW-7] Add default flow persister
item.description: Add default implementation of IFlowPresister

comments.comment: Actually it is not clear, how it should work.

item.title: [BFLOW-5] Enhance passed step validation on transition
item.description: Add validator that can allow step/transition just if the flow has already been a state. For example if there are many ways to reach "Payment Result" page, however nobody can entry this step without having passed "Confirm Order" step.
item.summary: Enhance passed step validation on transition

item.title: [BFLOW-4] Enhance dynamic validation system
item.description: Add dynamic validation system, that each step can decide by its validator if it can continue or not.
